q: Chrysler just started making its refreshed 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country in Windsor, Ontario, today but Fiat/Chrysler CEO Sergio Marchionne was already pondering the next-generation van. We need to completely rethink the minivan, he told the AP's Dee-Ann Durbin at the plant in Canada. "We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile." Simon Cowell writes I look upon it[ groveling] as a sign of desperation. So many times people come in and they come up with this terrible dialogue about how much they like me or Randy or Paula. It's demeaning, and there's no point to it. We're not looking for a nice person; we're looking for somebody who's confident and assured, but talented above all. Trust me-- most stars aren't nice. 2. - Donald Rumsfeld "goes so far as to depict former President Bush as presiding over a national security process that was marked by incoherent decision-making and policy drift, most damagingly on the war in Iraq."- Donald Rumsfeld remains largely unapologetic about his overall handling of the Iraq conflict and concludes that the war has been worth the costs. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power, he says, the Middle East would be "far more perilous than it is today'.- "Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops for the war, he allows that,` In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped"."

He explained: My wife will stay in her bedroom, she'll have her hair done nicely and make up so people can go singularly into the bedroom and talk to her. Maybe she understands them or not and maybe she cheers up. Working out how many candles to put on the cake might be a contentious issue though.
